{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3404969,"name":"Peter Clausen","username":"petedog07","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/petedog07/{size}/199760_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-03T07:15:16.414Z","cooked":"

hi everyone, i believe that my team is switching to onshape this year and previously we’ve been using solidworks only. I have 3 years of good solidworks under my belt and now i have to learn how to use onshape before this season and I was just wondering if anyone has tips, tutorials or add ons that would help in my re-learning of cad again. this could be a depository of links for add ons, videos, articles, and tips for anyone who is transferring.

i have very minimal knowledge of onshape but I dabbled in importing STEP files into onshape files for cloud access but thats about it. (and small part creation but that’s it)

if anyone has anything to help create a quick guide to onshape in frc, that isn’t directly from the basics, it would help a ton!

petedog07:

if anyone has anything to help create a quick guide to onshape in frc, that isn’t directly from the basics, it would help a ton!

Onshape4FRC

Home

Onshape CAD and Design resources to help teach for FRC.

There are a lot of quick guides to using Onshape for FRC, but this is the best IMO. It should cover pretty much everything you need to know to get started. I would also recommend getting an Education Plan and deciding on file organization and naming conventions early on, if you haven’t already.

This is one of my favorite Onshape tutorials currently, it’s relatively short but pretty feature complete.

After this going to Onshape4frc.com and look at how to use MKCad and the FRC specific features scripts.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-07-03T21:39:42.700Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":175,"readers_count":174,"score":185.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":468286,"topic_slug":"solidworks-to-onshape-help","display_username":"AllenGregoryIV","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GYkZmE_6MpY","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":6},{"url":"http://Onshape4frc.com","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Home | Onshape4FRC","clicks":2}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":10}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":10647,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Engineering Coach - Spectrum 3847/Photon 8515"},"post_url":"/t/solidworks-to-onshape-help/468286/5","custom_user_title":"Engineering Coach - Spectrum 3847/Photon 8515","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":10}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":10,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3405275,"name":"Beril Tokatlıoğlu","username":"beril","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/beril/{size}/229726_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-04T13:53:49.246Z","cooked":"

Hi there,
I believe the previous replies provided enough recommendations to improve yourself with Onshape. I also have three add-ons that I really like and use all the time when I’m modeling with Onshape, and the first one is MKCad, and it’s a library of very popular COTS parts that you can use directly in your Onshape assembly. You don’t have to lose time to import all COTS parts one by one, you can use this library to insert parts in seconds, and there are configurable part options as well. They gave all needed instructions about how to use it in the linked thread.

The other add-on that is used frequently is Some Helpful Featurescripts this one. You can get this easily as a custom feature and use it whenever you want. Especially after pocketing something when I need to fillet each corner I use “Fillet All Edges” from this featurescript. I really recommend it to save some time.

The last one is kind of new and I don’t have so much experience with it but a lot of people liked it.
Announcing KrayonCAD: A Robot Planning Library for Onshape When you’ll be designing a robot and need to see the very basics of each mechanism, you can use this library to create simple assemblies. Especially after kick-off when you’re starting to think about several different designs it’s helpful to know what they will look like and compare each design with KrayonCAD’s you made.

I hope this helps since I think these are some resources that are useful when you start to model with Onshape.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-07-04T20:17:08.618Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":86,"readers_count":85,"score":32.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":468286,"topic_slug":"solidworks-to-onshape-help","display_username":"Kanaan Kratzer","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":59729,"username":"beril","name":"Beril Tokatlıoğlu","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/beril/{size}/229726_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57510,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/solidworks-to-onshape-help/468286/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3405366,"name":"seg9585","username":"seg9585","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/seg9585/{size}/1974_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-04T20:54:54.999Z","cooked":"

Before I dive into the tutorials above, are any of them specifically geared towards demonstrating the differences in functionality between Solidworks and OnShape, rather than basics on how to CAD in general?

I’ve been using Solidworks for almost 20 years now, including some professionally, but I’m getting a lot of pressure to switch to OnShape this or the following year. Before I try to teach my students CADding in OnShape, I’d like to understand for myself the key deltas — both in the UI and the feature set — without sifting through tutorials trying to explain basic functionality

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-07-04T20:54:54.999Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":84,"readers_count":83,"score":36.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":468286,"topic_slug":"solidworks-to-onshape-help","display_username":"seg9585","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6078,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/solidworks-to-onshape-help/468286/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3405368,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-04T20:59:39.766Z","cooked":"

There’s an Onshape tutorial specifically geared for “you know how to CAD, now learn how to use Onshape”. I don’t remember exactly what it’s called, and I do believe it needs to be signed up for. 5-7 sessions, of which only the first is “basics” and even then it’s focused on differences between Onshape and other CAD. It’s not linked in this thread, though.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-07-04T20:59:55.474Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":80,"readers_count":79,"score":16.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":468286,"topic_slug":"solidworks-to-onshape-help","display_username":"EricH","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":6078,"username":"seg9585","name":"seg9585","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/seg9585/{size}/1974_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4212,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"#westandwithUkraine"},"post_url":"/t/solidworks-to-onshape-help/468286/9","custom_user_title":"#westandwithUkraine","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3405375,"name":"paulonis","username":"paulonis","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/5fc32e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-07-04T21:33:07.797Z","cooked":"

There is a “CAD Expert’s Guide to Onshape” playlist on YouTube. There are six short videos. The ones on top-down design, assemblies, and collaboration are perhaps the most useful from an FRC perspective. Not sure if these are tutorials in question, but they might be helpful.

There is also a huge playlist of videos where a “Solidworks expert learns Onshape”. These don’t seem to be focused on the fastest way to pick up Onshape as a Solidworks practitioner, but it’s more documentation of a personal journey. The “expert” happens to the same person who made the fantastic Onshape tutorial highlighted by @AllenGregoryIV above, so he must have made the transition from Solidworks very effectively, because his tutorial is incredibly rich and easy to follow.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-07-04T21:33:07.797Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":74,"readers_count":73,"score":29.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":468286,"topic_slug":"solidworks-to-onshape-help","display_username":"paulonis","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL4FdDkwWXT9qz1zlwZjcMxI9EmwTrMctB","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":4},{"url":"https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL4FdDkwWXT9qVqXGFaMNSXnBsBGcIpKsl","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":2}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22261,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/solidworks-to-onshape-help/468286/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3405383,"name":"Elliot S","username":"ElliotS","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/elliots/{size}/177628_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-04T21:53:17.008Z","cooked":"

Another thing to note that I have not seen here is you can rebind your controls to be same as Solidworks if you have not done that already. I have never used Solidworks so I don’t know how different our similar things are.
